direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve iterating over the entries of the map and constructing a string representation.
Both methods access the orderedKeys set to retrieve data, though keys() returns an Enumeration while toString() constructs a string.
Both methods iterate over the map's entries and perform operations on them, though forEach applies a given action while toString constructs a string.
The put method modifies the orderedKeys set, which is also accessed by the toString method to maintain insertion order.
The remove method modifies the orderedKeys set, which is also accessed by the toString method to maintain insertion order.
